creditline: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. Mark K. Kim
description: paintings of birds, foliage and water; predominant greens, blues and oranges
dimension: H.61 x W.15-7/8 x D.5-3/8 in. (overall, closed)
markings: seal, in red, LRC of PL painting
text: This charming screen illustrates paired birds amid flowering plants. The birds represent marital happiness and fidelity, while the flowers create a garden paradise. Such screens were commonly used to decorate the women's quarters within traditional Korean households. Families of humble means would hire itinerant painters to render colorful, naive scenes such as those shown here, whereas wealthy families might employ professional painters whose style was more precise and finished.
title: Paired Birds and Flowers
